intro: Lepicystis plebeia, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a spherical, green berry that turns red when mature, and it contains numerous seeds. Lepicystis plebeia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and wastelands.
